findings.title: Improper Logic of ERC721Base::_addTokenTo()/_removeTokenFrom()
findings.description: The _addTokenTo() and _removeTokenFrom() routines in the ERC721Base contract have improper logic, ignoring the fact that the index of the array starts from 0.

findings.title: Suggested Event Generation For Key Operations
findings.description: In Ethereum, events are indispensable and mainly used to record runtime dynamics. Several key operations lack meaningful events to reflect their changes.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The transfer function does not have a return value defined and implemented, which may cause unexpected reverts when interacting with non-ERC20-compliant tokens.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: The `GymStreet` protocol has a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol-wide operations.

findings.title: Timely Reward Dissemination upon Rate Change
findings.description: The `Mining` contract lacks timely invoking of `updatePool()` to update the pool reward status before the new reward-related configuration becomes effective, which may lead to unfair reward distribution.

findings.title: Improper Logic of Mining::getDateTimeConcat()
findings.description: The getDateTimeConcat() routine has an improper implementation that needs to be improved, which can cause different days to generate the same key.
